programmes.show_description: Shock and Awe: After the team's final experiment of the year, stunning revelations are made all across Skinwalker Ranch. (S5, ep 14)
In 1974, a Saskatchewan farmer reports seeing objects hovering in a field before they vanish into the ether. Connecticut citizens witness strange lights and a giant UFO in 1984. (S1, ep 13)
In 1993, a teenage girl walking her dog in Shropshire, England, witnesses a cylindrical object in the sky. School kids in Florida report multiple UFO sightings in 1967. (S2, ep 2)
The Time Benders: As more people open their minds to UFOs and extraterrestrial visits from lightyears away, this episode explores whether aliens can bend both time and space. (S14, ep 10)
Bad criminals, death-defying rescues and chaos in the skies all feature as the mayhem continues in Chaos Uncut. (S1, ep 10)
Naked ATV: A naked man allegedly steals an ATV, an individual who was feeding the alligators gets a visit from the police, and a store is robbed with the help of a front-loader. (S1, ep 1)
House of Cards: A high-rise hotel under construction on a busy New Orleans street unexpectedly collapses, leaving citizens baffled. (3 of 6)
Amy Got Back: Seth is shocked when Les brings back ex-pawn shop employee Amy. He later spots a mistake that could cost the store thousands of dollars. Is she to blame? (S7, ep 4)
Worksop 3: David Dickinson travels the country, team in tow, hoping to snap up some good deals. But will the locals take the cash for their antiques or gamble at auction? (S10, ep 34)
Huddersfield 3: Join David Dickinson as more collectors try to sell their items to dealers. Will they strike a deal, or will they take a chance at auction instead? (S10, ep 69)
The Pickers visit Armstrong in Abbotsford and Mission in British Columbia to compete to see who can obtain the manliest items. (S3, ep 5)
Henry Cole and restorers Allen Millyard and Guy Willison visit autojumbles in Stratford-upon-Avon and Enfield. (S2, ep 1)
You Can Lead a Horse to a Locker: Barry and Kenny show up in their alternative fuel vehicle. Meanwhile, Lisa does her best to break the curse of the bad locker. (S14, ep 3)
Piles to Go Before I Keep: Laura takes the reins in Fullerton and outsells Dan. Brandi gets assaulted by her locker and Darrell stumbles across an unexpected collection. (S14, ep 4)
Cold Blooded Robbery: Les ignores Ashley's cries to up security after she finds a potential robber hiding in the shop fridge. It's a move he may regret come nightfall. (S7, ep 7)
Les' Spending Spree: Les can't stop buying, even though the store room is piled sky-high. In danger of being dubbed a hoarder, he faces big pressure to make some sales. (S7, ep 8)
Off the Rails: With the power in their hands, will a seller toy with Chum's emotions when he gets his hands on a trio of vintage comic strip characters?
Lion Lady: A bride and her caterer are accused of drugging the wedding guests, while a woman climbs into the lion's den at the Bronx Zoo. (S1, ep 4)
Napping Burglar: A man decides to interrupt his crime to make a pizza. An unwanted intruder is arrested after he fell asleep while up to no good. (S1, ep 5)
Doomed From the Start: Italy falls victim to one of the worst engineering disasters when the Morandi bridge suddenly collapses. (4 of 6)
The Pickers visit Armstrong in Abbotsford and Mission in British Columbia to compete to see who can obtain the manliest items. (S3, ep 5)
In Pain in the Membrane: Ivy's locker shines some light on the business, while Lisa learns that she needs her locker about as much as she needs a hole in her head. (S14, ep 5)
How the West Covina Was Won: Lisa makes a big mistake as she's too busy looking back. Meanwhile, Rene gets his hands on a bargain and makes the most of it. (S14, ep 6)
Henry Cole chances his arm at a high class auction of vintage petroliana. (S2, ep 2)
On Location - Incredible Structures: Investigate 75 million years of credible evidence suggesting aliens have visited Earth. From cave drawings to phenomena in the skies. (S14, ep 11)
In 1968, airmen in North Dakota spot a huge UFO over one of the US' most high security Air Force bases. Papua New Guinea village locals report strange objects in the sky in 1959. (S2, ep 5)
In 2000, two brothers spot a UFO the size of six football fields after a hunting in Idaho. A Madagascan city is plunged into darkness when a metal craft hovers overhead in 1954. (S2, ep 6)
Bohemian Pawnsody: When Rick gets a chance at an iconic collection of Hard Rock photographs, can he capture a deal or will another one bite the dust?
You Can Lead a Horse to a Locker: Barry and Kenny show up in their alternative fuel vehicle. Meanwhile, Lisa does her best to break the curse of the bad locker. (S14, ep 3)
Piles to Go Before I Keep: Laura takes the reins in Fullerton and outsells Dan. Brandi gets assaulted by her locker and Darrell stumbles across an unexpected collection. (S14, ep 4)
Huddersfield 4: Join David Dickinson as more collectors try to sell their items to dealers. Will they strike a deal, or will they take a chance at auction instead? (S10, ep 70)
Man Vs Truck: A raging back and forth between three vehicles on a California highway ends with a man being rammed head-on by a truck. (S1, ep 1)
Rideshare Nightmare: It's a life-or-death situation in Reading, Pennsylvania, when a rideshare driver picks up a very dangerous passenger. (S1, ep 2)
Spirits haunt the basement of an abandoned winery and shadow figures catch a flick at a decades-old movie theatre. (S8, ep 7)
A baby monitor picks up a ghostly figure walking next to a child's bed and a young woman ushers in the new year with an undeniable sign from her late father. (S8, ep 8)
Haunted Grounds: A s√©ance stirs up grim ghosts from the past and a young girl encounters the spirit of a dead bride as people recall their homes becoming haunted grounds. (S1, ep 1)
In 1966, two Ohio police officers spot a strange light in the sky, triggering a chase across state lines. An ex-military man in Florida is knocked out by a beam of light in 1965. (S2, ep 3)
In 1977, Amazonian village locals have a frightening encounter when a UFO shoots beams of light at them. An Australian farmer sees a strange object descend from the sky in 1963. (S2, ep 4)
On Location - Incredible Structures: Investigate 75 million years of credible evidence suggesting aliens have visited Earth. From cave drawings to phenomena in the skies. (S14, ep 11)
Lion Lady: A bride and her caterer are accused of drugging the wedding guests, while a woman climbs into the lion's den at the Bronx Zoo. (S1, ep 4)
Napping Burglar: A man decides to interrupt his crime to make a pizza. An unwanted intruder is arrested after he fell asleep while up to no good. (S1, ep 5)
Doomed From the Start: Italy falls victim to one of the worst engineering disasters when the Morandi bridge suddenly collapses. (4 of 6)
Motor Mouth: Les is tempted to break one of the pawn shop's biggest rules, when a fast-talking client catches him off guard. (S7, ep 6)
Worksop 4: David Dickinson travels the country, team in tow, hoping to snap up some good deals. But will the locals take the cash for their antiques or gamble at auction? (S10, ep 35)
Canada's Roswell: On 4 October 1967, dozens of eyewitnesses reported seeing what appeared to be a UFO hovering above the water's surface in Nova Scotia. Was it an alien ship? (S1, ep 16)
Deep Sea UFOs: Red Alert: A look at the phenomenon of Unidentified Submerged Objects, believed to have been spotted as far back as the time of Alexander the Great. (S1, ep 17)
Black Box UFO Secrets: Audio recordings from the cockpit offer startling insight into real-life UFO sightings as pilots and astronauts narrate their bizarre encounters. (S1, ep 18)
The Pacific Bermuda Triangle: To the east of Japan in the Pacific Ocean, an area known as the 'Dragon's Triangle' has reportedly claimed ships and aircraft for centuries. (S1, ep 19)
Texas' Roswell: In April 1897, an unidentified craft crashed in Texas. Locals claimed they buried the spaceship and its alien pilot. Can a new search uncover the remains? (S1, ep 12)
War Games: In 2023, David Grusch - a former US Intelligence Officer - testified to a US government committee that there are alien spacecrafts at secret facilities. (S1, ep 7)
Hotspots: Some places are known for so many reports of UAP sightings that people flock from all around the world, just to catch a glimpse of a flying saucer. (S1, ep 8)
Juneau: Expert Chris Rutkowski, home to the largest UFO research archive, sets the scene and explains an unexplained event. (S1, ep 6)
UFO sightings are at an all time high. What makes these mass sightings incredible is also what makes them terrifying, and what might happen next? (S1, ep 5)
Hook Island Monster, Skydivers' Plane Stall, and Somalia Freighter Phantom: The team explore possible proof of a sea monster, a tale of a skydive gone wrong, and a ghostly image. (S3, ep 8)
Panama UFO Disc, Bloody Red Sea, and the Dyatlov Pass Incident: The team examine a strange UFO sighting, the sudden appearance of a red sea and possible proof of a Yeti. (S3, ep 9)
Decode the mysterious Arizona desert cypher, discover the lair of the war elephant and beware the zombie village. (S5, ep 17)
Witness unexplained shapes in the deserts of Genghis Khan, see the mystery fleet of ice planes at the end of the Earth and look down at Kim Jong Un's terror factory from space. (S5, ep 18)
Discover the link between Nazis in New Mexico and a mystery craft in Roswell, explore Australia's underground labyrinthine abyss and decode the cypher of Atomic Island. (S5, ep 19)
The Voynich Manuscript: A look into a medieval manuscript filled with drawings and secret code, that has perplexed everyone from scholars to conspiracy theorists. (S3, ep 9)
The Lindbergh Baby Kidnapping: A media storm explodes when the infant son of an aviation legend is kidnapped and sparks a nationwide manhunt. (S3, ep 11)
The Chicago Tylenol Murders: Cyanide-tainted Tylenol capsules links the victims of a series of unexplained deaths in the 80s together. To this day, what happened is a mystery. (S3, ep 12)
Mystifying Cursed Objects: Ancient cultures around the world have aroused fascination and provoked fear with curses and objects used to conjure them. (S1, ep 8)
Battle of Gergovia: In 52 BC, after eight years of warfare in Gaul, Julius Caesar and his legions laid siege to Gergovia - but he faced a coalition of all the Gallic tribes. (S2, ep 4)
Strange Tales of WWII: Throughout history's largest and deadliest human conflict, a number of intriguing and persistent mysteries were born - from lost gold to secret societies. (S4, ep 8)
